channel.title: Character models
channel.description:
Hey,
I'm trying to grab models of 'Characters' (NPC/Player) using reflection. Only problem is, there is no field which stores them. There is a local array which seems to temporarily hold them but not for long enough for reflection to grab. So what alternatives are there?

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:14, topic:398554”]Thanks. Don’t need the coloring.
Not being animated is probably ok, because reflection + SMART is super slow at grabbing models anyway - its almost useless on a moving target.[/quote]If you plan to use it for accurate clicking it’s a viable way to do it, i did it a year ago or so and had no issues. Used it for game objects as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Same applies to Player

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Thanks. Don’t need the coloring.
Not being animated is probably ok, because reflection + SMART is super slow at grabbing models anyway - its almost useless on a moving target.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:12, topic:398554”]There are generic “base” models of each NPC stored in a Hashtable (indexed by ID) in NpcDefinition class… it however is not include the associated graphic nor is it “animated”, and it doesn’t have proper face recoloring[/quote]Ya, that.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

There are generic “base” models of each NPC stored in a Hashtable (indexed by ID) in NpcDefinition class… it however is not include the associated graphic nor is it “animated”, and it doesn’t have proper face recoloring

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:1, topic:398554”]Hey,

I’m trying to grab models of ‘Characters’ (NPC/Player) using reflection. Only problem is, there is no field which stores them. There is a local array which seems to temporarily hold them but not for long enough for reflection to grab.
So what alternatives are there?[/quote]If my memory serves me correctly, it’s stored in a jagex hashmap in the definition class.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s all here if you wish to see it:

GitHub

BenLand100/SMART

SMART Minimizing Autoing Resource Thing --- A tool to run the RuneScape Client in a sandbox


He does hi-jack the canvas class, I’m not sure if you can do that with a java-agent or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

they dont need to control the class loading, they are avoiding at all costs any form of dectectability, this is why i assume they are using reflection opposed to bytecode editing. however using a custom loader could possibly get the account caught, so when using an agent on a browser applet you would eliminate multiple possibilities of getting caught.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

why would you use an agent when you control the classloading?

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

OK, so it uses an unofficial loader then?, it would be better to use a java-agent in this instance.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

SMART doesn’t use a hacked client, it loads it with an AppletStub, pretending to be a browser. That said, it’s open source and you can make it modify bytecode as it loads it fairly easily.

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

smart still uses a hacked client anyway, the difference between reflection and bytecode editing now is preference. you would be stupid not to edit the clients bytecode.

runescape == botscape

Read full topic

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

It’s for SMART. So no, only reflection sadly.

Read full topic

item.description:

Maybe he’s trying to ignore the whole bytecode editting part.

item.title: Character models
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Can you only use reflection? What if you edit bytecode and cache the ‘local array’ for use later?

Read full topic
